p: Effective entomological surveillance ( http://www.institutpasteur.nc/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/) identified Ae. aegypti as the main vector for arboviruses in NC. The Larvae and Pupae Index (LPI) is a proxy for Ae. aegypti density and was calculated as the average number of late-instar larvae and pupae per house for 300 randomly selected houses visited per month. LPI remained low from 2010 to 2016 in Noumea ( http://www.institutpasteur.nc/wp-content/uploads/2016/12/) ( Figure 1C) but a dengue outbreak occurred in 2013 nevertheless. As documented elsewhere [ 4], vector densities therefore seem to play a limited role in conditioning the occurrence of arbovirus outbreaks in NC.
